import React from 'react'; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom'; const Home = () => { // Sample unit data - in a real app, this would come from an API const latestUnits = [ { id: 1, name: 'Goku Ultra Instinct', rarity: 'Mythic', element: 'Light', image: '/api/placeholder/150/150' }, { id: 2, name: 'Rimuru Tempest', rarity: 'Legendary', element: 'Water', image: '/api/placeholder/150/150' }, { id: 3, name: 'Madara Uchiha', rarity: 'Mythic', element: 'Fire', image: '/api/placeholder/150/150' }, { id: 4, name: 'Ichigo Bankai', rarity: 'Legendary', element: 'Dark', image: '/api/placeholder/150/150' } ]; const metaUnits = [ { id: 1, name: 'Saitama', tier: 'S+', element: 'Physical', winRate: '94%', image: '/api/placeholder/150/150' }, { id: 2, name: 'Gojo Satoru', tier: 'S', element: 'Light', winRate: '89%', image: '/api/placeholder/150/150' }, { id: 3, name: 'Anos Voldigoad', tier: 'S', element: 'Dark', winRate: '87%', image: '/api/placeholder/150/150' } ]; const getRarityColor = (rarity) => { switch (rarity) { case 'Mythic': return 'text-red-400'; case 'Legendary': return 'text-yellow-400'; case 'Epic': return 'text-purple-400'; default: return 'text-anime-secondary'; } }; const getTierColor = (tier) => { switch (tier) { case 'S+': return 'text-red-400'; case 'S': return 'text-yellow-400'; case 'A': return 'text-green-400'; default: return 'text-anime-light'; } }; return (
